New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers became the first team in NBA history to win its first 10 games and score at least 110 points in each of them.
The Cavaliers are the first team to start 10-0 since the 2015-16 Warriors.
Cleveland built a 41-point halftime lead at 83-42, tying the eighth largest in the NBA's shot clock era.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland scored 27 points and Evan Mobley had 23 as the Cavaliers routed the Golden State Warriors 136-117.
Backup guard Ty Jerome scored a season-high 20 points against Golden State.
Pre-Game Insights: Kenny Atkinson expressed concern about facing the Warriors, acknowledging their status as champions.
Steve Kerr commented on Atkinson's fit with the Cavaliers, noting the continuity and quality of the team.
Post-Match Reflections: Kenny Atkinson expressed pride in the team's 10-0 start and noted the team's readiness and hunger.
Jarrett Allen acknowledged the team's potential for improvement and praised Atkinson's coaching.
Ty Jerome highlighted the team's fast and enjoyable style of play, crediting Donovan Mitchell and Darius Garland's selflessness.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers lead the league in points per game at 124.5 and with a .527 field goal percentage.
Cleveland has outshot its opponent in each game but has won the rebounding battle only four times.
The Cavaliers committed 20 turnovers that led to 32 points for the Warriors.
